intro: Ferula minkwitzae, commonly known as the Afghan cow parsley, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Afghanistan. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its tall, slender stems and white to pale yellow flowers. The plant produces a distinctive, aromatic resin that has been used in traditional medicine. Its leaves are finely divided and often covered in a fine layer of white hairs, contributing to its ornamental appeal. Ferula minkwitzae is adapted to grow in arid and semi-arid environments, thriving in well-drained soils.
